dataIdInfo.idCredit: Derek Olson, Joshua Reynolds, Peter Davis, Caleb Pan, GTAC, RedCastle Resources, USFS

tool.name: ZonalStats

param.name: unique_id_field
param.dialogReference:
Field that holds the values that define each zone.

It can be an integer or a string field of the zone dataset.

param.name: raster_directory
param.dialogReference:
Directory that contains the rasters on which to calculate statistics.

Tool supports both integer and float rasters.

param.name: Subset_Statistics_to_Export
param.dialogReference:
IMAGERY: MEAN, MEDIAN, STD, RANGE

STRUCTURE: MEAN, STD, RANGE, SUM

ELEVATION/CLIMATE: MEAN, STD

CATEGORICAL: MJR, MNR

param.name: table_join_type
param.dialogReference:
Determines what type of join will be used to merge zonal stats table. Only important if not all layers cover the zones dataset.

  • INNER —Zones that intersect the least encompassing raster layer will be kept. Zones that are missing a calculation are not kept. This is the default.

  • Outer—All zones are kept, even those with no data.

param.name: keep_zones_with_no_data
param.displayname: Keep Zones With No Data Pixels
param.dialogReference:
Denotes whether NoData values in the Value input will influence the results of the zone that they fall within.

  • KEEP —Within any particular zone, only cells that have a value in the input Value raster will be used in determining the output value for that zone. NoData cells in the Value raster will be ignored in the statistic calculation. This is the default.

  • DISCARD —Within any particular zone, if any NoData cells exist in the Value raster, it is deemed that there is insufficient information to perform statistical calculations for all the cells in that zone; therefore, the entire zone will receive the NoData value on the output raster.

param.name: convert_float_to_int
param.dialogReference:
Option to convert float rasters to integers before processing. This allows for all expected statistics e.g. median to be calculated.

  • CONVERT —Convert any float rasters or raster bands to integer by applying the specified conversion scale value

  • DON'T COVERT—Leave float rasters as float; not all statistics will be calculated

param.name: conversion_scale_value
param.dialogReference:
If converting float rasters to integer, this value will be used to scale the raster e.g. (raster * 100).

This parameter is ignored if not converting rasters to integer.

param.name: Keep_Count_Area_Fields
param.dialogReference:
Determine whether or not to keep or drop the COUNT and AREA fields. These are not typically used in modeling.

  • FALSE —Drop the COUNT and AREA field during merging of tables. This is the default.

  • TRUE —Keep the COUNT and AREA fields.

param.name: output_table
param.dialogReference: Output table that will contain the summary of the values in each zone. Exported table will be in .csv format.

tool.summary: Summarizes the values of a raster(s) within the zones of a feature layer and reports the results to a table (csv only). Must be run through ArcPro.
tool.usage: Summarizes the values of a raster(s) within the zones of a feature layer and reports the results to a table (csv only). Must be run through ArcPro. Summarizes each raster in a designated folder for each zone in a vector dataset. Each table is merged into one using pandas.
